Description: Safe Harbor is a Cisco initiative that provides large enterprise companies with a robust Cisco software version of choice. Safe Harbor focuses on satisfying customer quality requirements in key vertical markets. This program links and expands on several Cisco testing projects, including development, regression testing, and systems testing critical to the success of large enterprise organizations. Safe Harbor certification marks the successful completion of extensive testing that validates each release. Customer documentation summarizes the results from a Safe Harbor test cycle and includes the DDTS number for any anomalies experienced. 
I was involved in the safeharbor certification of Cisco Firewall Service Module(FWSM). FWSM is a service module which can be inserted in a catalyst 6500/7600 series of switches. 
 
Responsibilities 
Developing test plans for the new features in FWSM including Route Health injection, DCERPC inspection, ESMTP Enhancements 
Execution of the safeharbor manual and automated testcases and bug reporting for the Cisco FWSM 4.0.4 image. 
Working with the developers for reproducing bugs. 
Automation of few safeharbor testcases using Tcl 
 
S/w Tools : IxLoad, IxNetwork, IxExplorer, Spirent Avalanche and Reflector, Bugzilla, CDETS, Harbor Master(Safeharbor harness) and Cisco Security manager. 
H/w Tools : Catalyst 6500, Cisco FWSM and Cisco NAM 
 
Achievements 
Got a Cisco CAP(Cisco Achievement Program) award. 
Worked single handedly and executed more than 200 testcases 
Successfully worked with multiple development teams (Service cards team from ISBU and FWSM team from ADBU) 
Collaborated excellently with the sanjose team for the testbed related issues and lab move as the testbed was in Sanjose. Consultant Engineer @ Ixia Afila Tech India Pvt Ltd May 2007  –  September 2007  (5 months) IxANVL Testing 
Description: Testing the features and functionality of the Conformance testing tool IxANVL 
 
Responsibilities:  
Testing the functionality of IxANVL for the module Ethernet CFM. 
Verifying the Test methodology used in test plans. 
Created alternative methods to test this feature as currently no device was available in the market  
Verifying the conformance of PDU transmitted by the ANVL with the standard IEEE 802.1ag D8.1 
Writing IxANVL DUT configuration scripts using Tcl/Expect. 
 
S/w Tools : IxANVL (Windows as well as Linux), IxVNIC, Ethereal, Tcl/Expect, Serena (Bug tracking tool). 
H/w Tools : Optixia X16, Cisco ME3400.
